item.title: 265 – Amen
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Amen God bless the thick consistency of American-made peanut butter and over-the-counter pain-relieving ointment. Holy are they and much praised. Amen.
item.content:encoded:
Amen

God bless the thick consistency
of American-made peanut butter
and over-the-counter pain-relieving ointment.
Holy are they and much praised.
Amen.

item.title: 264 – Páramo
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Páramo The underwear I washed by hand, rinsed, wrung and wrung, hung on a line among other fluttering pairs– a united nations of undies– stained, stretched, torn, less elastic than once they were, disheveled and well worn, of all sizes … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Páramo

The underwear I washed by hand,
rinsed, wrung and wrung, hung
on a line among other fluttering pairs–
a united nations of undies–
stained, stretched, torn, less elastic
than once they were, disheveled
and well worn, of all sizes and shapes–
are gone.

Stolen, I hope, by some desperate commando
in need of girded loins, or blown
by the wind into the páramo,
a tinge of bright color caught up
in dead grasses, peeking out from under dust,
livening up the empty rolling brown
no-man’s land below.

item.title: 263 – Hummingbird
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Hummingbird the thoughts I try not to catch land softly like the hummingbird at the vine a beautiful blur most clear when I look away
item.content:encoded:
Hummingbird

the thoughts I try not to catch
land softly
like the hummingbird
at the vine
a beautiful blur
most clear when I look away

item.title: 262 – In a Small Mtn Town
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: In A Small Mtn Town His fork worked a slow circle against the spoon turning pasta bolognese into something he could fit inside his mouth. He said his father’s dead. Four months. He sipped vino tinto waiting for the translation … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
In A Small Mtn Town

His fork worked a slow circle
against the spoon
turning pasta bolognese
into something he could fit
inside his mouth. He said
his father’s dead. Four months.
He sipped vino tinto
waiting for the translation
slowly unraveling
towards comprehension.
We sat in silence
and then called the waiter
for more wine.

item.title: 261 – Villavanta
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Villavanta Moments when what I carry bends me to the wind fields black full of broken sunflowers are the flowers I choose to bring back to you from the black fields full
item.content:encoded:
Villavanta

Moments when
what I carry
bends me
to the wind

fields black full
of broken sunflowers
are the flowers
I choose

to bring
back to you
from the black
fields full

item.title: 260 – Pictures
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Pictures When we return they’ll say we should have taken more photos. Let them capture the broken light molded to the bent heads of sunflowers. Let them press their fingers to the silver, leave their own marks in the printed … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Pictures

When we return they’ll say
we should have taken more photos. Let them
capture the broken light molded
to the bent heads of sunflowers. Let them
press their fingers to the silver, leave
their own marks in the printed dust
of skin and precious metal. Let them
capture the wind drifting gently
across their faces.

item.title: 259 – Grace
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Grace I don’t care about your dead phone battery. Your slight discomfort. And I hate the way your Spanish shrugs out of your mouth, moldy. I have such little grace for you when all you want is to find a … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Grace

I don’t care about your dead
phone battery. Your slight discomfort.
And I hate the way your Spanish shrugs
out of your mouth, moldy.
I have such little grace
for you when all you want
is to find a toilet, to understand
the subtle differences of the tongue,
to know  if you’re paying a fair price
for the cheap scallop earrings
glinting on the side of the road.

item.title: 259 – Crossing
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: We cross without ceremony an invisible line across the sea. The dreamers are restless in their seats. Far below the Atlantic tosses and tosses all night long. We wake to dry ground.
item.content:encoded:
We cross without ceremony
an invisible line across the sea.

The dreamers are restless
in their seats.

Far below the Atlantic tosses
and tosses

all night long.
We wake to dry ground.

item.title: 257 – JonahwhatImean?
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: JonahwhatImean? Who knows? The LORD may yet repent. Who knows the LORD? May yet. Repent. Who? Knows the LORD? May yet? Repent? Who knows the LORD may yet repent. (Jonah 3:9)
item.content:encoded:
JonahwhatImean?

Who knows? The LORD
may yet repent.

Who knows the LORD?
May yet. Repent.

Who? Knows the LORD?
May yet? Repent?

Who knows the LORD
may yet repent.

(Jonah 3:9)

item.title: 256 – Dusk
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Dusk All the hammers have stopped for the day A violin lesson strains out an open window Plates clatter, chatter at the neighbors Ice cubes melt in an inch of gin A lawn sprinkler raises a lazy hand in slow … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Dusk

All the hammers have stopped
for the day

A violin lesson strains
out an open window

Plates clatter, chatter
at the neighbors

Ice cubes melt
in an inch of gin

A lawn sprinkler raises
a lazy hand

in slow greeting
and farewell

playing a subtle hush
on the rhododendron
